Open Records Requests
All Open Records Requests must be directed to Dawn Turner, Polk County's Records Custodian. Requests will only be addressed after the Records Custodian receives a request. You may email her at dturner@polkga.org
Emergency Closing Phone Number: 678-901-4652
Updated Polk County Development Regulations

div.div:
Your locally elected officials (mayors and county commissioners) of Northwest Georgia are required, by state law, to update and create a five-year plan for the region. The Northwest Georgia Regional Council, made up of the region's locally elected officials, is responsible forgathering feedback from the public in order to create a plan that addresses the region's top priorities. By taking this brief survey you can give your community's leaders the input they need to determine the region's needs and how to best address those needs.
Please click this link to share your important feedback. Take the Survey!

i.b: ****Please Note: Due to the current situation with the Coronavirus this may be streamed live.

div.br:

Tuesday April 7, 2020
Regular Meeting 7:00 p.m.
Current Board of Commissioner's Agenda
Deadline for adding items to the Agenda is 12:00 noon on Tuesday before the work session and regular meeting.

div.div:
Polk County Residents can be notified within minutes of a National Weather Service warning, issued for the following local weather events:
Severe thunderstorms
Flash floods
Tornados
To receive these notifications, however, you must take a few moments to register an account on the Code Red website (clicking on the link or the Weather Warning icon will open up a new web browser window).

Mr. Jason Cox has 25 years of service with Polk County and contributes daily to the department in numerous ways. He always has a good attitude and is willing to do whatever is asked of him with no complaints. Jason plays a vital role to our departments success. February Employee Of The Month

We at the Polk County Jail value our employees and their concerted effort to maintain operations during holidays, peak times, and situations like we now face. Ms. Autumn Akins is a shining example of those employees. During the month of December many of the staff requested leave to spend time with their family: Autumn was happy to fill in and help make that possible for her co-workers. We are very proud of her sense of duty and commitment to co-workers and citizens.
